column3: NACK. It is there as a very low level debug measure. If the code is operating normally then we don't even need to look at the debug.log. If for example something is stopping the accept but the code does not fail properly, then it helps us. \n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/7ce253a8b841f62ac6a34499bea45c6c505b0ace for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
NACK. It's useful for debugging to know when ProcessBlock is finished, as it seems to take a long time sometimes. \n
@laanwj How about if i change this patch so that it's displayed only when it takes a long time (and include the duration with the message)?\n
No, let's just leave it as it is. It's easy enough to see the duration of events by the difference in timestamp.\nLet's try to fix issues instead of discussing about debug log messages...\n
